comment_3:
By far one of Kenny's greatest songs, both vocally and lyrically. He's saying that in the end, no matter how much it's hurting her right now, he is not the right guy for her. Throughout the song he lists off his qualities, stating that who he is just isn't the right fit for her. He sees her starting to fall in love with him, he can tell that it would be an unrequited love, so he's ending it now in attempt to save her from further pain. 

Haunting, beautiful song.

He needs to let her go so she can be happy...
"I see you leaning, you're bound to fall,
I don't want to be that mistake" 

 He doesnt want to break her heart anymore because he know he will.  So he let's her go and it hurts her but he knows in the long run she's going to find a man that loves her the way she deserves cause she's probably really hot!

So below are the verses where he says trust me pretty much someday you'll thank me for letting you go...

But one day you're gonna find someone,
And right away you'll know it's true
That all of your seeking's done

P.P.S-  She will never forget this boy, and kept a plank for that pirate man on her bridge.
The End. But not really.

comment_16:
This song is not only for a man player. That's so steryotypical.

Let's just that Kenny is actually experiencing these feelings and similies like he describes.

All of what he says, just shows that you'll "break my heart, but it wont bleed" and that's just who he is.

He'll stand alone through all the lovers he'll find. The song is so rich, and deep with so many instances that i've found through all my relationships in my life. The fact that he states, "i'm pretty good on a lonely night, and "never stay but then again i might" shows the uncertianty of his doing, and that you can never trust a man that's "only friends are pirates"

"cause goodbyes are like a roulette wheel, you never know where they're gonna land"

Makes me cry everytime. Its so true how, sometimes you just cant describe what you heart does.


Similar to another country song, "you cant make a heart love somebody" you can find many similarities. Everyone's been in one of those relationships where they just love interest and who knows why. 
Kenny's describing the fickleness that a heart can have,, and how, despite the happiness he could give you, "he's better as a memory, than as your man"


Amazing. Absolutely astonishing the depth that is found from kenny, and especially in a country raido song.
